meanings.definition: A flat surface capable of supporting weight, typically constructed outdoors and connected to a building.
meanings.sent1: The workers were painting the deck of the house.
meanings.sent2: We enjoyed a barbecue on the deck in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ran across the deck, looking for hidden acorns.
meanings.sent4: The deck of the ship creaked as it sailed through the storm.
meanings.sent5: The sun beat down on the deck, warming the wood.

meanings.sent1: She shuffled the deck before dealing the cards.
meanings.sent2: We played a game of poker with a full deck of cards.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of the deck of cards.
meanings.sent4: The deck of cards was neatly stacked on the table.
meanings.sent5: He always carries a deck of cards in his pocket for entertainment.

meanings.definition: To knock someone to the ground with a punch.
meanings.sent1: He tried to deck his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent2: The boxer managed to deck his rival in the final round.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he could deck anyone with his sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: She threatened to deck him if he didn't stop teasing her.
meanings.sent5: The bully attempted to deck the smaller kid, but he dodged the punch.
